intro: Amellus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are perennial herbs native to North America. The plants typically have basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. They produce small, greenish or white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Amellus species are often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
